ovdesc.p: This application holds the contract definitions of all of the contract types tradable in the derivatives module.

desc.p: To avoid potentially infinite small price fluctuations, an exchange limits the minimum amount by which prices may change. This is movement conventionally known as the "Tick".
The tick size of a 3-month Short Sterling Contract is 0.01; therefore the quote will change by 0.01 tick.
The minimum price movement does not necessarily move by the tick size, as half and quarter price movements are now practiced in the markets of today.
Up to 11 numeric characters available, expressed in the same format as price
Mandatory field
Multi-valued set by price band
No Change field
Internal price defaulted from EXPIRY.PRI field
NOINPUT

Regarding the Risk country: The problem here is similar to that of the risk currency. Many instruments are issued in a tax haven and will have this as security country. The security country has tax implications, it is relevant when it comes to Double Tax Treaties and will cause a certain withholding tax. It is also relevant for the Swiss stamp duty calculation. But when Japanese Company decides to issue a Eurobond in London, the risk country will most probably be Japan in such a case. Many unit trusts are issued in Guernsey, in British Virgin Islands or in the Bermudas, but the underlying instruments come from other countries. Also it should be possible to open artificial countries such as Europe or World as risk countries. It can be estimated that about 20 % of instruments have different risk- and security countries in a security database. For this reason the security country is not generally applicable for asset management decisions.
On RISK.COUNTRY field a drop down list will be made available showing valid entries from the T24 application COUNTRY.
Each position in clients portfolio must be attributed a risk currency and risk country back office users will update this information to correctly show where the risk for an instrument lies.
If No input this field would default to the contract currency.
Country from the T24 application COUNTRY.
The full description of the contract
Eg. Long Gilt, 3-Month Short Sterling, etc…
Up to 35 Alpha characters Multi-value field
Mandatory field.
The valid maturity days for the delivery period defined in MONTHS.FWD.
Up to 35 date formula characters available
Unless MATURITY.TYPE is populated by 'DAILY' or 'OTHER' this field is NOINPUT.
Attached with if the type of contract is an OPTION otherwise no input field. It defines whether a partial delivery is allowed for the contract or not.
Up to 3 characters
No Input unless CONTRACT.TYPE = ‘OPTION’. Input must be YES/NO
No Change field
This field is defaulted from the EXCHANGE.MASTER if not populated
Up to 25 alpha characters
Default from EXCHANGE.MASTER Null.
Must be a valid record in DX.MARGIN.CALC with TYPE = "VARIATION"
This field allows the use of a manual input date to override the field populated by a formula used to calculate the SPOT.DATE
When populated, the date formula in the previously populated LAST.TRADE, FIRST NOTICE, etc…., will not be used in the fixing and calculation routine for this contract.
Up to 8 Date Format characters available. (YYYYMMDD)
This is part of a multi-set field with OVR.MONTH.YEAR
Choose from the drop down menu YES or NO to confirm contracts traded are allowed to settle/close out with other contracts or left open as a held position.
Up to 3 Alpha character allowed.
If this field is left Null it will default information from DX.EXCHANGE.MASTER.
Input is YES/NO
Delivery date.
In the case of cash settled contracts, the delivery day is known as the 'final settlement day'.
e.g.
Italian Government Bond : delivery must be notified on the specified notice day
Long Gilts : delivery can be notified by the seller of the contract, on any day in a specified delivery period.(from the start of the delivery month to the expiry day)
For Options, unless cash settlement applies, the delivery day is the day on which the underlying instrument must be delivered, if the contract has been exercised.
Up to 35 date format characters available.
Date Formula "+3WE,-1BD" = 3
Rounding factor is an optional input with the following restrictions on the integer and fractional part :
1. The fraction is restricted to the Strike price scale i.e. < scale factor
2. Unless the Price Scale factor is 100, integer part cannot be used
Optional Input

Maturity/Delivery months are generally set to meet the needs of the underlying cash market. A traded contract has a specified delivery month set by the relative exchange within the contract specifications. This field is used to populate the said month for that period.
The drop down menu allows the choice of numeric (1-12) or alpha ALL to populate this field. The numeric of 1-12 represents the twelve calendar months.
e.g. 3-month Short Sterling :
March, June, September, December and two serial months, such that 22 delivery months are available for trading, with the nearest 3 delivery months being consecutive calendar months.
This equates to, trading 3 months consecutively and then quarterly up to 22 periods.
Up to 3 alpha or numeric characters Available
Enrich with month abbreviation from REMTEXT
No Change field
This field allows the use of a manual input date to override the field populated by a formula used to calculate the year and month delivery date.
When populated, the date formula in the previously populated LAST.TRADE, FIRST NOTICE, etc…., will not be used in the fixing and calculation routine for this contract.
Up to 8 alpha/numeric characters available.(YYYYMM)
This is a multi-set field with OVR.LAST.TRADE, OVR.FIRST.NOTICE, OVR.LAST.NOTICE, OVR.FIRST.DLV, OVR.LAST.DLV, OVR.SPOT.DATE, and OVR.DEC.DATE
For contracts where the available maturity months are quoted as
e.g. LIFFE Cocoa Futures - maturity on March, May, July, September, December cycle such that 10 trading months are available:
AVAIL.MONTHS = 10
MONTHS.FORWARD = OPEN
MATURITY.MONTHS = 03,05,07,09,12
Up to 3 characters
No Change field

When populated, the date formula in the previously populated LAST.TRADE, FIRST NOTICE, etc… will not be used in the fixing and calculation routine for this contract
Up to 8 Date Format characters available. (YYYYMMDD)
This is part of a multi-set field with OVR.MONTH.YEAR

Input must be either YES or NO or blank
Amortise; accounting procedure that gradually reduces the cost value of a limited life or intangible asset through periodic charges to income.
The number of days that the profit or loss should be amortised over.

The contract maturity type as set on the contract specifications by the relative exchange. Choose from the drop down menu, DAILY, MONTHLY, OTHER.

MATURITY.TYPE is part of the setup for trading periods on a contract specified to the relative exchange. This field works in conjunction with AVAILABLE PERIODS, MONTHS FORWARD, MATURITY MONTHS AND MATURITY DAYS
Up to 7 Alpha characters available

No Change field

This records holds details pertaining to each instrument that is supposed to be trading. On input of DX.TRADE details will be updated from this record once the DX.CONTRACT.MASTER id is input and validation is taking place when a manual input of price, lot, trade dates / month etc are input.
This record hold the information on whether it is a FUTURE, OPTION or STOCK. STOCK and FUTURE behave same way it is only for internal classification.
numeric value upto 12 characters.

Input allowed YES or NO

SETTLEMENT charges applied when trade closed-out, matured or exercised/expired (option trades only).

e.g. 3-month Short Sterling (LIFFE) ; Trading unit of 500,000 per lot

E.g. Tonnes, Bushels, Lots, etc….
Up to 35 Alpha characters available
Mandatory field
Price offset from strike price for expiring options.

Some exchanges specify for certain contracts a price difference where the option will automatically be exercised when they are so much "in the money" (in profit). Conversely there may be a margin where an option is "out of the money" (in loss, i.e. negative profit) but some customers may still wish to exercise. For this reason exchanges may stipulate a greater degree of loss before an option is automatically expired.
An option is out of the money, and will therefore be expired if.
For a call option (buying at the strike price):-
Market price of underlying - strike price GT (>) EXPIRY.PRI
For put option (selling at the strike price):-
Strike price - market price of underlying GT (>) EXPIRY.PRI
Must be valid price scale and minimum price movement for the underlying asset / product
Identifier of a price interface known to T24. Can be an actual interface or TRADE to define T24 trade entry price format.
Must be a valid Price set in DX PRICE SOURCE
Multi value set with Price Set
15 Alpha
Specifies an alternative easy means of referencing the Contract.
Like the ID, the Mnemonic must be unique across T24.
Care should be taken when assigning Mnemonics to Contracts and some rules should ideally be defined across the bank to allow easy identification of the Customers by their Mnemonics.
3-10 type MNE (Uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha, or ".") characters.
Mandatory input
The price variance allowed from the official market price, populated to the field in percentage terms.
Up to 3 numeric characters available
2 Multi-value set by price band.

'n' (being the numeric in days).

Holds override messages generated during input of this record.
No Input
Price offset from strike price when exercising for customers who are exchange members.

Some exchanges specify for certain contracts a price difference where the option will automatically be exercised when they are so much "in the money" (in profit). This may be to take into account the additional costs of exercising the option.
Therefore for exchange members, an option is in the money, and will therefore be exercised if.
For a call option (buying at the strike price):-
Market price of underlying - strike price GE (>=) EXER.PRI.MEM
For a put option (selling at the strike price):-
Strike price - market price of underlying GE (>=) EXER.PRI.MEM
Must be valid price scale and minimum price movement for the underlying asset / product.
Delivery method for specified contract at maturity
CASH - Delivery of cash equivalent to contract realized value
PHYSICAL - Physical delivery of underlying instrument
NONE - No delivery method specified (defaults to NONE)
Up to 8 alpha characters
This is a mandatory field
Default is NONE
No Change field
Price multiplication factor. Defaults to 1 if null.
Example: LIFFE 3 Month Short Sterling contract price quoted ref full year’s interest- MULT.FACTOR = 0.25
Up to 11 characters
No Change field.
Details of the contract specification currency are entered in this field as set by the relative exchange. This is the user-defined alpha currency code

This field contains the currency code and is entered in Alpha format. This code comprises of three alpha characters as defined in the currency table. It is recommended to use the standard SWIFT currency code, which is the internationally recognised convention for currency codes. The following are examples of ISO/SWIFT codes:
- USD = US Dollars - GBP = Pounds Sterling - DEM = Deutsche Marks - FRF = French Francs

p.p: Corresponds to a record id on the Currency table.

TRADE; The premium will be paid or received in full on the trade date.
SETTLEMENT; The premium will be posted on the day of settlement, close/expiry of the trade.

Input allowed only when INT.RATE.CONTRACT is set to “YES” .
Should be specified in number of days or month or years. Eg :- 20D, 5M, 2Y and so on.

eg. LIFFE, EUREX, CBOT etc……

Must be a valid ID/Mnemonic on DX.EXCHANGE.MASTER

This field defines at the contract master level whether the trades covered by this contract master record can undergo back to back closeout
Defaults from DX.CONTRACT.CLASS but can be amended manually
This field specifies the type of rounding method to be applied, which can be one of the following:
STANDARD - It will round either upwards or downwards whichever is nearer integer, to the required number of decimal places
UP - It will round upwards to the required number of decimal places
DOWN - It will round downwards to the required number of decimal places
Input can be STANDARD, UP or DOWN, default being STANDARD
The type of option traded, normal (vanilla) or Exotic.
Exotic; Digital, Currency, etc…..
This multivalue set will contain a list of valid option.types for this contract.code Or ALL. This is linked to a record in
DX.OPTION.TYPE
Up to 8 alpha characters
Identifies a price set that holds prices for this contract.
Must be a valid Price set in DX PRICE SET
Multi-value set with Price Source
15 Alpha

This field represents the Risk Currency, the most frequent examples are unit trusts. A German Fund Administration might decide to issue a US equity fund, and, because it might be more convenient for the investors, might issue and price the units in Euro. The legal security currency is Euro. But if the Dollar changes its value to the Euro, this will have an impact on the market value of this fund because the underlying equities are mostly exposed to the USD. Another example is a European Bond Fund quoted in Sterling and issued in the UK. The risk currency in such a case could be Euro, but could as well be artificial like 'European currency'. Another example is a German Certificate of a US company. It is issued in Germany, priced in Euro, but the risk currency is not Euro but USD. Apart from the asset type breakdown, within the field of asset management, the risk currency is usually considered to be one of the most important attributes of an instrument. As a general rule about 10 % of all instruments have a different security and risk currency.
On RISK.CURRENCY field a drop down list will be made available showing valid entries from the T24 application currency
Default to trade currency if no input
Taken from theT24 applicationn"CURRENCY"
The type of contract that has been traded on an exchange.

p.p: Input must be one of the following: OPTION/FUTURE

desc.p: The financial instrument, equity or commodity upon which a futures or options contract is based.
These may be a specific instrument, as in the case of stock options, or maybe a notional instrument, as in the case of the Euro Bund futures.
In the case of many Options, such as the Long Gilt and Euro Bond options on LIFFE, the underlying instrument is a corresponding futures contract.
This field requires to be set as 'OTHER' for Interest rate Caps, Floors and Swaptions
If underlying is cash Delivery currency field is mandatory
Up to 12 Alpha characters
Input must be a valid record on either DX.CONTRACT.MASTER or SECURITY.MASTER, or 'CASH' or 'OTHER'
The basis on which the price for this contract is quoted.
Choose from the drop down menu of INTEREST or NORMAL.
e.g. 3-month Short Sterling; 100-Libor rate = Quote Price, therefore is interest rate based.
Up to 8 Alpha characters available
Default to NORMAL
No Change field
Internal price defaulted from EXER.PRI.MEM field.
NOINPUT

e.g.

The routine used for automatic assignment of options. For exchange regulated contracts, the routine must meet any rules governing the assigment of options. See application DX.CO.ASSIGN.AUTO for details on running automatic assignment.
Input must be a valid record on DX.OBJECT.LIBRARY
25 Alpha
This field specifies the id of the new contract master record created on corporate action, which supersedes this contract master record
No input field
Price offset from strike price when exercising for customers who are not exchange members.

Some exchanges specify for certain contracts a price difference where the option will automatically be exercised when they are so much "in the money" (in profit). This may be to take into account the additional costs of exercising the option.
Therefore for non exchange members, an option is in the money, and will therefore be exercised if.
For a call option (buying at the strike price):-
Market price of underlying - strike price GE (>=) EXER.PRI.NON
For a put option (selling at the strike price):-
Strike price - market price of underlying GE (>=) EXER.PRI.NON

Main price data such as the price basis (INTEREST for interest-rate basis prices, NORMAL otherwise) are same for all prices on a contract, but in same cases values like tick size and value may vary when the contract price falls within different bands. This is catered for by mulvaluing the PRICE.BAND to INT.PRICE.BAND set.
The value is calculated by price band / tick size x tick value. This is a system generated field.
Up to 11 character
No Input field

The code for the relevant price of the contract on the relevant exchange or price vendor system, the "Ticker Symbol". This can be left as to "LOOK UP" which allows DX.PRICE.INTERFACE to determine the format.
Up to 20 Alpha characters available
Multi-value set with PRICE SOURCE
No Input field
1 Numeric character allowed
Default to '2' if not populated/null
Reserved For Future Use
No Input field

The unit of quotation allowed is conventionally known as the "TICK". To avoid potentially infinitely small price fluctuations, the relative exchange, limits the minimum amount by which prices may change. This is set within the contract specification as the tick size.
The tick size for a 3-month Short Sterling future is 0.01.
The tick size for a 3-month Short Sterling option to a level of 7 price units is 0.005
The tick size for a 3-month Eurodollar futures is 1/32.
Up to 11 Numeric characters available
Mandatory field
Multi-value set with Price Band
No Change field
Basis of the strike price for this contract.

Up to 5 characters in TIME format
No Input unless CONTRACT.TYPE = ‘OPTION’
This Field requires the Code Identifier provided by an Exchange for clearing and reporting purposes. No input is required if it does not differ from the T24 mnemonic.
Up to 10 Alpha characters long.
Default to mnemonic if NULL.

e.g. The 3

The Last day on which, for a given futures or options contract, delivery can take place.
In the case of cash settled contracts, the delivery day is known as the 'final settlement day'.
e.g. below

Long Gilts and some Commodity Contracts: delivery can be notified by the seller of the contract, on any day in a specified delivery period.(from the Start/First of the delivery month to the Expiry/Last day)
For Options, unless cash settlement applies, the delivery day is the day on which the underlying instrument must be delivered, if the contract has been exercised.

Validation Rules:
Up to 15 Alpha characters available
Mandatory Input
No Change field
THIS FIELD IS NO LONGER USED
Eg : Australian Bills & Bonds on the SFE

Some contracts are subject to a price band, specified on the contract specification set by the relative Exchange. This field works in conjunction with Tick Size, Tick Value, and Minimum Price Movement.
An example of price band contract is the 3 Month Short Sterling Option;
<7(note not equal too) price units the Tick Size is 0.01, Tick Value is 12.50(6.25 1/2 tick) and the minimum price movement is 0.005
>7 price units the Tick Size is 0.01, Tick Value is 12.50 and the minimum price movement is 0.01
This equates; the movement up to 7 price units will be per half tick and above 7 price units per one tick.
The set is then multi-valued where the,
Up to 16 characters available in "CURRENCY'" format or Alpha "OPEN" for no price band.
Multi-value Set with Tick Size, Tick Value, Minimum Price Movement and Price Tolerance.
Price Band, field is shown as an "Up Too" figure.
No Change field

AMERICAN; An option that may be exercised at any time prior to its expiry date
EUROPEAN; An option that may only be exercised on its expiry date.
CARRIBEAN:
A type of option that can only be exercised on predetermined dates, usually every month.

Example: 70 = 70% Margin (Contract is worth 70% actual value for Client valuation purposes).

e.g. 3-month Short Sterling :
March, June, September, December and two serial months, such that 22 delivery months are available for trading, with the nearest 3 delivery months being consecutive calendar months.
This equates to, trading 3 months consecutively and then quarterly up to 22 periods.

Select YES to enable system exercise of options when process routine is included as part of End of Exchange processing.
Input must be either YES or NO or blank
Identifies the group of like Contracts, which are reported together.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters – code must exist on the SUB.ASSET.TYPE table.
Mandatory Input
No Change Field
The latest time on the expiration date on which the Seller must accept notice of Exercise as specified in a confirmation.
Up to 5 characters in TIME format
No Input unless CONTRACT.TYPE = ‘OPTION’
Days offset to apply settlement postings
Validation
Input defaults from DX.EXCHANGE.MASTER
No Change
Number of days offset from charge posting date to actually generate postings.
Up to 3 characters
If left null will default from DX.EXCHANGE.MASTER
Identifies the name of the Contract in a more descriptive form, and will be used for on-line enrichments in any field where a Contract ID or Mnemonic has been input.

A clear and unique identification of the Contract must be entered in this field. When entering or displaying data where a Contract ID or Mnemonic is involved, the content of this field will be used as the enrichment of the Contract number/Mnemonic.
3-35 characters. Multi value field
Mandatory input
The number of decimal places for the price quote. This also changes the number of decimal places in the multi-value set of Price Band.
1 Numeric character allowed
Default number of decimals from the CURRENCY if NULL.
Reformat the other prices e.g. PRICE BAND
No Change field
Decimal places for the CONTRACT SIZE.
1 Numeric character allowed
Default to '0' if not populated/null
No Change Field
Based on value provided in this field update to table DX.CONTRACT.DATES happens. Options allowed to this field are CALC.ONLY, TABLE.CALC.UPDATE and TABLE.ONLY.
When set to CALC.ONLY or NULL system always calculates the dates based on the formules provided to date fields.
When set to TABLE.CALC.UPDATE system referes to the formulae in dates field and calculates the date and updates to DX.CONTRACT.DATES.
When set to TABLE.ONLY user has to manually update the DX.CONTRACT.DATES from where the dates are considered.
When set to YES will suppress the creation of underlying during closeout process. Defaults with value set in SUPPRESS.UNDERLYING field of DX.PARAMETER. Can be changed for individual contract level.
Up to 3 characters
YES or NO are allowed values
When set to YES and the exotic event triggered the exotic trade should get automatically expired by DX.CO.EXPIRE.MANUAL. This value set here can be overwritten at trade level.
Upto 3 alphanumeric values
Valid inputs are either YES or NO
Indicates the percentage loss margin allowable on this Contract.
If not entered, the margin allowed for the "SUB.ASSET.TYPE" will be used.
Up to 5 Alphanumeric characters.
Must exist on the MARGIN.CONTROL file

The settlement mode of the option contract is specified in this field. The option can be physically settled (Delivery/Receipt of the underlying takes place )or Cash settled (The cash difference is settled). Possible values are PHYSICAL or CASH. NULL value would by default use physical settlement
The alternative settlement instrument for equity option when not given settled with equity in UNDERLYING field.

When the delivery method is cash, and value given in this field then the payout for an cash option to happen in this currency else Forex trade gets created. The currency should be different from trade and delivery currency.
When set to YES alone Mark-to-Market (MTM) entry is posted.This gets defaulted from DX.PARAMETER.

The allowed values are PROFIT.LOSS and OPTION.VALUE. When set to PROFIT.LOSS the difference between trade and market cost is posted. When set as OPTION.VALUE the entire market cost is posted on the first day.This gets defaulted from DX.PARAMETER.

The allowed values are ADJUST and REBOOK. When set to ADJUST the difference between pevious day and todays MTM amount is posted as entry. Whereas when set to REBOOK the previously posted MTM is reversed and the new MTM amount is posted.This gets defaulted from DX.PARAMETER.
When MTM.SPEC is set to YES, instead of raising the internal account entry based on ACCOUNT.CLASS category SPEC entry is raised.This gets defaulted from DX.PARAMETER.
When set to YES it means the Financial Transaction Tax is exempted for the contract. This gets defaulted at trade level which can be overwritten.
A valid Country code can be specified. The field is for information purpose.
